For those who played the games on home consoles growing up, this is the definitive experience for better or for worse. Thank goodness these games are finally on Steam, because I refused to sign up to a different storefront just to be able to play KH.

IMO the games rank as follows:
1) Kingdom Hearts 2 (Obviously)
2) Kingdom Hearts: Birth by Sleep
3) Kingdom Hearts
4) Kingdom Hearts: re:Chain of Memories

I actually really like all four games, even re:COM (I loved the Gameboy Advance game as a child) but as I'm going through the platinum trophy run for each of these games re:COM was definitely one of the worst grinds. The story itself in that game is great, and really important. Personally, I enjoy the card mechanic and think it's a great alternative.

KH2 is about as polished as it's going to get in a Kingdom Hearts game. It's known as the best of the best for a reason. It's definitely better than Kingdom Hearts 3, and I don't know whether that's down to the fact that KH3's climactic story felt super rushed, or that KH2 had you revisit multiple worlds to get the whole story whereas KH3 was very much 'one and done' a bit like Birth by Sleep (but BBS was a Playstation Portable game from 2010, so you're not expecting mainline game quality for a spin-off).

Overall, this package is great, and if you can grab it on sale even better. I'm on game 4/4 right now (with 358/2 days and Re:Coded being basically movies, no gameplay) going for the 'perfect game' accolade and I'm 220 hours in. I think I've got another 40 or so hrs in me until I'm finally done. Then I can have peace.
Under the sea. Under the sea. Darling it's better down where it's wetter, take it from me. 10/10

I really feel I have been healed by this game. I struggle with autism and ADHD and this game helped me to understand my emotions really well. The feeling of 'I can't remember you but you feel familiar' message that KH puts forward so often tells you your feelings matter, even the ones that don't make sense.

I felt especially invested in Birth By Sleep and it was preparing you to watch Re:coded and I just felt my heart breathe. The whole series deliberately makes your heart ache and if you stick to the end, it eventually gives you the closure you need.

If you are really emotionally sensitive and want some closure for your aching heart and some fun with combat too, it's really good. I would only be careful with Chain of Memories - it's good, but it's a different type of game with the card system. It's jarring at first but you get used to it.

Also, 358/2 days and Re:coded are films, not games but really touching ESPECIALLY 358/2 days. It also has KH I which is great and the introduction to the series and KH II - the only annoying aspect of KH II was the constant cutscenes and not enough combat sometimes but an amazing story. I still really like Roxas's section despite it being the start as it really helped me connect with him as a character.

To finish this review off, if you like connecting with characters and an engaging story, this is for you so please enjoy it like I did.

I've only beaten KHFM in this collection and just started ReCoM, but I already got my money's worth (it was on sale for $25). One of the benefits you have with this on Steam compared to other platforms is how easy it is to cheat, both for the obvious reasons you'd cheat and for things like enabling challenge runs. For example, if you want to grind but just don't have the time and/or patience for it, you can enable an XP multiplier cheat that makes it go faster. On the other hand, you could use that same XP multiplier cheat, but set the multiplication value to zero and now you gain no XP (which isn't always necessary because in some games there are ways to do the same thing without cheating, but not in all of them). You can also do things like play with the wooden sword for the whole game, or make it so you have no party members for a solo run. Also, you can use mods to return the Final Mix games' enemies' color palettes to their original versions, if you don't like the FM versions.

Individual reviews for each game:
-KH1: the classic. no nitpicks I have about early installment jank can change the fact that it's amazing. Probably still the best 'overall' title for exploration, combat, story, visuals, music, and RPG mechanics as a total package, even though some later entries exceed it in single categories.

-Re:CoM: There's stuff about the story that's cool but im sorry this battle system doesn't work. Only one I got close to the end but didnt finish. Just too aggravating.

-365/2 (cutscenes): I get why this is important to the story of the organization but it loses something by skipping over almost half of the time that passes between major events. It's not like the original game was that fun but the cycle of daily missions *did* on some level form part of the story. Still made me feel something.

-KH2: Absolutely GOATed action game and maybe my personal favorite. The pinnacle of both combat and narrative for the whole series- but I will admit that it's not that 'total package' like 1, it suffers a lot in every category except those two.

-Recoded (cutscenes) : who cares lol

-BBS: I used to think this game's move crafting system was the coolest thing ever. After having beaten it I do resent how it replaces the main series' actual action combat with cooldowns and makes normal attacks filler. It's a slog if you play through it back to back, but it was occasionally mindless relaxation and the story was good.

For those wondering about the play order for the best experience, follow this list:
1) Kingdom Hearts Final Mix
2) Re: Chain of Memories 
3) Kingdom Hearts II Final Mix
4)  358/2 Days (2 hour-long Movie, if you can emulate the OG DS game go for it instead)
5) Birth By Sleep (Terra -> Ventus -> Aqua. This game has three stories)
6) Re:Coded (you can skip this one)

Then you can play 2.8 and III if you wish to continue, if not, just play KH1 and 2 and call it a day.

Also  you can play Final Fantasy 7,8 and 10 before playing these games if you want to POG every time an FF character makes a cameo (pls more FF characters in KH4)
